1465452008572293122.text: BIG NEWS! Tomorrow, I’ll join @POTUS as he signs the first #Momnibus bill into law! 1354877459766894594.text: During this Special Enrollment Period, nearly 9 million uninsured Americans could enroll in an affordable health plan that not only covers COVID-19 testing and treatment, but also mental health and substance use disorder services, prescription drugs, and more.

1354877304384569344.text: Now more than ever, Americans need access to affordable health care. I am pleased to see President Biden take immediate action to reopen the ACA open enrollment period to ensure people have the health coverage they need during #COVID19.

1354868969417666560.text: Under the No Coronavirus Copays for Veterans Act, federal protections passed in the CARES Act will be extended to veterans who receive care through the VHA to eliminate out-of-pocket costs for #COVID19 vaccinations and other preventive services.

1354868967714807812.text: As our nation continues to face this pandemic, it’s critical that veterans do not face barriers to COVID-19 vaccines & preventive services. I'm introducing the No Coronavirus Copays for Veterans Act with @SenDuckworth, @RepBrownley, @RepBrianFitz, & @RepLeeZeldin to address this. https://t.co/Z1ig4g2iYS

1098960897161289729.text:
We will never forget Russell, Clayton, Josh, Trevor, and Vicente. And we will never forget the bravery of law enforcement and first responders who rushed toward the violence and undoubtedly saved countless lives. 

May our community come back stronger and safer than ever before.

1098960755993559041.text:
We remember Vicente Juárez.

El patriarca de una familia grande y muy unida, Vicente era un gran esposo, padre y abuelo de ocho nietos. Sus vecinos lo amaban por sus esfuerzos para eliminar el vecindario de dientes de león cada verano—algunos años con más éxito que otros.

1098959531512684544.text:
We remember Trevor Wehner.
 
A college student at Northern Illinois University killed on the very first day of his internship. He was described by a friend as someone who would go out of his way for others.

1098958192376188929.text:
We remember Josh Pinkard.
 
“I want to shout from the rooftops about how amazing Josh was!” his wife wrote this past weekend about a man who loved God, family, and college football.

1098957726695215104.text:
We remember Clayton Parks.
 
A Northern Illinois University grad who his wife described as an incredible father to their young son.

1098957626250018818.text:
We remember Russell Beyer.
 
Proud chair of his union and a 20-year employee of Henry Pratt, Russell was a father of two and a steadfast Patriots fan.

1098957519651782656.text: It’s been a week since five people were killed in an act of gun violence in #Aurora. Seven days of shock. Seven days of mourning. And seven days of incredible strength by the families and our resilient community.

1096522076817625088.text: Closely monitoring the horrifying news in #Aurora and am on my way home to be with neighbors. 1092996398042234880.text: I’ll join anyone to help make quality healthcare more affordable, to improve our nation’s infrastructure, and to alleviate new and unfair tax burdens placed upon Illinoisians and I hope Republicans in Congress and the President come to the table with me in those efforts.

1092996322091810817.text: But, Illinoisians don’t need their elected officials dug-in on partisan positions or practicing unreasonable negotiating tactics like shutting down the government. They need us to get to work and work together.

1092996219662684160.text: Tonight was a unique opportunity to discuss how we can make progress on issues and move our country forward, and I was pleased to hear the President mention important things we need to get done for the American people like paid family leave.

1092926887893053441.text: My face when Allie surprised me with a note from my fourth grade and her kindergarten teacher, Mrs. Wilkie 😆 https://t.co/wJlCJOHT3l

1092924445033984002.text: Pit stop on our way to #SOTU to learn about other inspirational women https://t.co/zLRt8b707B

1092923107768262656.text: She is such a good reminder that our country is a better place when we all are doing our part to spread kindness and make positive change in our communities.

1092922957058531329.text: Tonight I’m thrilled to bring Allie as my very first #SOTU guest. At just 7-years-old Allie lifts up our community of Naperville by leaving handwritten notes and drawings to support domestic violence victims, new college students, and anyone who may need positive encouragement https://t.co/GE8fXiiTkd

1092884013096812546.text: Yes, Allie, the President’s speech is a big deal and you’ll get to meet important people while you’re here! So glad you’ll be with me—my colleagues and I have a lot to learn from you and your willingness to spread kindness and lift our community. https://t.co/WSw0m409tR

1091818567958433795.text:
Great to see so many friends at Woodstock Square this morning, the backdrop for the film Groundhog Day. 

Even MORE excited that Woodstock Willie didn’t see her shadow! Looking forward to a quick thaw and an early spring!

#HappyGroundhogDay https://t.co/zFnVse9Ob0

1090970533238321154.text: This week I was selected to serve on the Disability Assistance & Memorial Affairs subcommittee of the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee (@VetAffairsDems). Excited to get to work to ensure veterans get the health benefits they deserve after putting their lives on the line.

1090707469050040320.text: The Rebuild America’s School Act helps not only our students, but also our economy. By investing more than $100 billion in school infrastructure, this bill would create 1.9 million good-paying jobs for local workers. #RebuildAmericasSchools

1090705920202543104.text: Every student, regardless of their family’s wealth, should have access to a safe, welcoming, and high-quality public school. That’s why I’m co-sponsoring the Rebuild America’s Schools Act. #RebuildAmericasSchools

1090660839265390592.text: When it comes to men and women: same work, same pay. Period. Proud that every member of the Democratic Caucus has signed on to the Paycheck Fairness Act.

1090660761083527169.text: Women still only make about 80 cents every $1 earned by a man. That gap is even wider for women of color. Compared to white men, African American women are paid 61 cents, Latina Women are paid 53 cents, and Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander women are paid 62 cents.

1090660689180381184.text: Today I stood tall with many Democratic women to support #PaycheckFairness and I’m proud that every single member of our caucus has signed on to the Paycheck Fairness Act for #EqualPay. https://t.co/EtIiddhjEC

1090415030284230656.text: I've heard from families across #IL14 that they're feeling the burden of the state and local tax deduction changes in the Republican Tax Bill. @RepCasten and I are working to get answers from the IRS.

1090285942974369792.text:
Nonpartisan @USCBO says the GOP shutdown cost us $3 billion in economic activity that can’t be recovered. THREE BILLION DOLLARS over partisan politics. 

Let’s hope this report marks the end of senseless shutdowns & hurting American workers & families as a negotiating tactic.

1088542652763701249.text: Presiding on the floor this afternoon as we discuss the need to #EndTheShutdown.  Tune in on C-SPAN

1088106762790682624.text:
To round out my committee assignments, I will serve on the Committee on Homeland Security (@HomelandDems)!  Eager to begin our work on border security, cyber security, health security and oversight of the Department of Homeland Security #forthepeople. 
https://t.co/Pdb1RqjQDp

1087572002293104640.text: So pleased to speak with these bright journalists today about #IL14 and legislative priorities. https://t.co/mfXZxGvKWw

1085982356714991616.text: Very excited to serve on the House Committee on Veterans Affairs! @VetAffairsDems https://t.co/B7P5thokn0

1085633613629177856.text: We dropped the letter with Sen. McConnell’s capitol office, Republican Cloakroom, on Senate Floor and his personal office. Everywhere we went, we left the same message: #EndTheShutdown and re-open government. https://t.co/NYmubyBEKb

1085550412223127552.text: An honor to meet the dedicated activists from @AMarch4OurLives last evening.  Ready to work in partnership to end gun violence, beginning with HR 8, universal background checks. https://t.co/yJlQMnatpR

1085207048210522112.text: Honored to participate in this important hearing to discuss the impact of the shutdown on Indian Country as a member of the Democratic Steering and Policy Committee. #EndTheShutdown https://t.co/OKx9BAAUca

1085189403180359680.text: First set of committee assignments are in! I’ll be serving on the @EdLaborCmte! #IL14

1084845502636703745.text: I stand with the 99% of federal workers in EPA Region V who are furloughed across the Great Lakes states. That’s why I voted to fully fund the EPA and #EndTheShutdown so these hard working people can continue their critical protection, monitoring and enforcement duties.  2/2 https://t.co/fR0tG3Jj57

1084842140990095361.text: I met with AFGE Local 704 president Mike Mikulka and #IL14 residents of @704afge this weekend. They expressed deep concern that their critical work to protect public health, safety and our environment has stopped during this needless shutdown. 1/2

1084839289375084544.text:
Last week I voted to #endtheshutdown and fully fund the Emergency Food Assistance Program, which funds food banks and food pantries like @ILfoodbank and @loaves_fishes, to end hunger here in northern Illinois.  

https://t.co/SlHTI7sqya

1084453394264326158.text: It was an honor to celebrate our ceremonial swearing at @neuquavalley. It’s a new day in #IL14 and we’re committed to serving in a way that is accessible and transparent https://t.co/KvOEwY45MG

1083169697099669505.text: Critical consumer protections have been halted during this shutdown. Voted tonight to make sure we have properly funded identity theft reporting programs and to restart the popular National Do Not Call Registry... we need our federal employees back at work asap!

1083168682631675904.text: Tonight, I also voted to fund the Small Business Administration. Our local small businesses and entrepreneurs have been some of the hardest hit during the government shutdown...access to capital is down $90 million per day! Looking to the Senate to pass this funding bill now.

1083167934439137280.text: Once again, tonight I voted to re-open the Treasury Dept and IRS so that we can meet the needs of the American people. So critical that folks across #IL14 can get their tax refunds without delay! The Senate needs to bring this bipartisan bill to the floor for a vote now.

1083116654870040576.text: Gave my first floor speech this afternoon on the urgent need to protect healthcare for families across Northern Illinois https://t.co/MRiYX8SQGO https://t.co/RXLXoTminm

1081570970190651392.text: Please join us on Saturday, January 12 for a ceremonial swearing in beginning at 10am in Naperville. #IL14 https://t.co/gSrU3iPrY1

1081561720311767040.text: I’m proud to support this important package of reforms to restore integrity in government and ensure each and every American can fully participate in our democracy. 3/3

1081561518418800641.text: In the Democratic Majority, we are demonstrating a commitment to conducting the business of our Nation with the highest standards of ethics and decency. 2/3

1081561004981534726.text: I am proud to support #HR1 - the For The People Act - a historic government reform bill to restore democracy, strengthen voting rights, and end culture of corruption. This week marks a new beginning in the House of Representatives. 1/3

1081254441704189956.text: I was proud to vote for the bipartisan bill to end this #TrumpShutdown and reopen government #ForThePeople. https://t.co/bfggkNHi3r

1080997169501519873.text: Today I celebrated my swearing-in and my first legislative victory! So honored to represent #IL14 https://t.co/7QmLLFLK4b https://t.co/JSEgJ9AbBL
